FuncDef: The display dot1q information termination command displays the names of all sub-interfaces for Dot1q VLAN tag termination, Dot1q termination configuration information, and the number of VLAN groups configured on these sub-interfaces.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an interface.
-

Specifies the type of an interface.
-

Specifies the number of an interface.
-

Examples: <HUAWEI> display dot1q information termination interface Eth-Trunk10
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If multiple sub-interfaces for Dot1q VLAN tag termination and VLAN groups are configured on a device, run the display dot1q information termination command to check the names of sub-interfaces for Dot1q VLAN tag termination, Dot1q termination configuration information, and the number of VLAN groups configured on these sub-interfaces. With this information, you can determine whether the configuration is correct and locate faults.
Prerequisites
Dot1q termination has been configured correctly. Otherwise, a message indicating that information to be viewed does not exist is displayed when you run the display dot1q information termination command.
